member.name: M:Ranorex.Plugin.Driver.Browser.HandleDocumentDisposed(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Since closing a single document (window handle) does not work properly at the moment, the whole browser session is closed instead. The main issue with close document was, that a javascript call after closing lead to a very unstable and slow selenium server.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Plugin.Driver.JsonDom
member.summary: The Wire protocol data structure that allows 'efficient' data transfer.
member.remarks: This is a weird data adaption layer that we needed, because we completely switched the JS-script that fetches the DOM shortly before the release and didn't want to change all code throughout the plugin itself. The thing this stuff does not reconstruct is the old metadata structure. There we will simplify the processing in the consumer classes.

member.summary: This method is used when trying to perform an update but endpoint is not connected. In this case the sessions are only cleared. So the sessions are not displayed. If the reason was a temporary network failure than the sessions are rebuild with the next update.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IJavaScriptExecutor.ExecuteScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.param: The JavaScript code to execute.
The arguments to the script.
member.returns: The value returned by the script.

remarks.para: The method executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window. This means that "document" will refer to the current document. If the script has a return value, then the following steps will be taken:

item.description: For an HTML element, this method returns a
For a number, a is returned
For a boolean, a is returned
For all other cases a is returned.
For an array,we check the first element, and attempt to return a of that type, following the rules above. Nested lists are not supported.
If the value is null or there is no return value, is returned.

remarks.para: Arguments must be a number (which will be converted to a ), a , a or a . An exception will be thrown if the arguments do not meet these criteria. The arguments will be made available to the JavaScript via the "arguments" magic variable, as if the function were called via "Function.apply"

member.summary: Executes JavaScript asynchronously in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.param: The JavaScript code to execute.

member.returns: The value returned by the script.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.GoToUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Load a new web page in the current browser window.
member.param: The URL to load. It is best to use a fully qualified URL
member.remarks: Calling the method will load a new web page in the current browser window. This is done using an HTTP GET operation, and the method will block until the load is complete. This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.GoToUrl(System.Uri)

This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user can define timeouts.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.ImplicitWait
member.summary: Gets or sets the implicit wait timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.AsynchronousJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the asynchronous script timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously. This timeout only affects the method.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.PageLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the page load timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user controls the browser.
member.remarks:
The interface is the main interface to use for testing, which represents an idealized web browser. The methods in this class fall into three categories:
Control of the browser itself
Selection of IWebElements
Debugging aids
Key properties and methods are , which is used to load a new web page by setting the property, and the various methods similar to , which is used to find IWebElements.
You use the interface by instantiate drivers that implement of this interface. You should write your tests against this interface so that you may "swap in" a more fully featured browser when there is a requirement for one.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL the browser is currently displaying.
member.remarks: Setting the property will load a new web page in the current browser window. This is done using an HTTP GET operation, and the method will block until the load is complete. This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Title
member.summary: Gets the title of the current browser window.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.PageSource
member.summary: Gets the source of the page last loaded by the browser.
member.remarks: If the page has been modified after loading (for example, by JavaScript) there is no guarantee that the returned text is that of the modified page. Please consult the documentation of the particular driver being used to determine whether the returned text reflects the current state of the page or the text last sent by the web server. The page source returned is a representation of the underlying DOM: do not expect it to be formatted or escaped in the same way as the response sent from the web server.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.CurrentWindowHandle
member.summary: Gets the current window handle, which is an opaque handle to this window that uniquely identifies it within this driver instance.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user controls elements on the page.
member.remarks: The interface represents an HTML element. Generally, all interesting operations to do with interacting with a page will be performed through this interface.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.TagName
member.summary: Gets the tag name of this element.
member.remarks: The property returns the tag name of the element, not the value of the name attribute. For example, it will return "input" for an element specified by the HTML markup <input name="foo" />.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Text
member.summary: Gets the innerText of this element, without any leading or trailing whitespace, and with other whitespace collapsed.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Enabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is enabled.
member.remarks: The property will generally return for everything except explicitly disabled input elements.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Selected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is selected.
member.remarks: This operation only applies to input elements such as checkboxes, options in a select element and radio buttons.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Location
member.summary: Gets a object containing the coordinates of the upper-left corner of this element relative to the upper-left corner of the page.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Size
member.summary: Gets a object containing the height and width of this element.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Displayed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is displayed.
member.remarks: The property avoids the problem of having to parse an element's "style" attribute to determine visibility of an element.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Clear
member.summary: Clears the content of this element.
member.remarks: If this element is a text entry element, the method will clear the value. It has no effect on other elements. Text entry elements are defined as elements with INPUT or TEXTAREA tags.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.SendKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Simulates typing text into the element.
member.param: The text to type into the element.
member.remarks: The text to be typed may include special characters like arrow keys, backspaces, function keys, and so on. Valid special keys are defined in .
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not enabled.
Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits this element to the web server.
member.remarks: If this current element is a form, or an element within a form, then this will be submitted to the web server. If this causes the current page to change, then this method will block until the new page is loaded.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.

remarks.para: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined. behavior.
If this element is not clickable, then this operation is ignored. This allows you to simulate a users to accidentally missing the target when clicking.

member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.param: The name of the attribute.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element:
Attribute name Value returned if not explicitly specified Valid element types
checked checked Check Box
selected selected Options in Select elements
disabled disabled Input and other UI elements
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a JavaScript property of this element.
member.param: The name JavaScript the JavaScript property to get the value of.
member.returns: The JavaScript property's current value. Returns a if the value is not set or the property does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType
member.summary: Represents the known and supported Platforms that WebDriver runs on.
member.remarks: The class maps closely to the Operating System, but differs slightly, because this class is used to extract information such as program locations and line endings.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Any
member.summary: Any platform. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Windows
member.summary: Any version of Microsoft Windows. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.WinNT
member.summary: Any Windows NT-based version of Microsoft Windows. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities. This value is equivalent to PlatformType.Windows.

member.summary: Versions of Microsoft Windows that are compatible with Windows XP.

member.summary: Any version of the Linux operating system.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.ImplicitWait
member.summary: Gets or sets the implicit wait timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.AsynchronousJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the asynchronous script timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously. This timeout only affects the method.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.PageLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the page load timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of the element
member.remarks: This property is internal to the WebDriver instance, and is not intended to be used in your code. The element's ID has no meaning outside of internal WebDriver usage, so it would be improper to scope it as public. However, both subclasses of and the parent driver hosting the element have a need to access the internal element ID. Therefore, we have two properties returning the same value, one scoped as internal, the other as protected.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Clear
member.summary: Clears the content of this element.
member.remarks: If this element is a text entry element, the method will clear the value. It has no effect on other elements. Text entry elements are defined as elements with INPUT or TEXTAREA tags.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits this element to the web server.
member.remarks: If this current element is a form, or an element within a form, then this will be submitted to the web server. If this causes the current page to change, then this method will attempt to block until the new page is loaded.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.
member.remarks: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined behavior.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not enabled.
Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.param: The name of the attribute.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element:
Attribute name Value returned if not explicitly specified Valid element types
checked checked Check Box
selected selected Options in Select elements
disabled disabled Input and other UI elements
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.summary: Gets the value of a JavaScript property of this element.
member.param: The name JavaScript the JavaScript property to get the value of.
member.returns: The JavaScript property's current value. Returns a if the value is not set or the property does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.
